name: City Tempo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is really good value for a convenient central well appointed affordable base from which to explore downtown Melbourne.
reviews.title: Prompt, courteous, efficient service, and a clean well equipped comfy room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I had a great stay at the City Tempo. We were there over New Years for about a week. The rooms are small but newly renovated and ours was very clean. We especially enjoyed the included stereo with a built-in iPod hookup.
reviews.title: Outstanding service with new rooms and a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff far exceeded our expectations. Every time we had a question (and we had several) they were quick to check online, make phone calls, or do whatever they could to help point us in the right direction. Madi at the front desk was especially helpful with this.
reviews.title: Perfect. New and Clean. Excellent Location. Excellent Value. Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is a bit north of the main attractions, but we had no problem walking a few blocks. If you're not a walker a short cab ride will get you to most places you want to go.
reviews.title: Found an affordable gem in the city

reviews.text: The unti also came with basic kitchen facilities in case you want to make a meal, etc. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Melbourne.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartments are very new and located only a few minutes walking distance from Victoria Markets and 15 min from the CBD. There is a IGA and liquor store right accross the road. The service of the apartments is reasonable. House Keeping will clean your bathroom and kitchenette and make your bed if you wish on a daily basis. Towels and linen are only changed after 3 nights but there is a washing machine/dryer. Thanks to the reviews of other travellers we booked a 1 BR apartment. It was functional but very compact and the studio would have been like a box. The airconditioners in the lounge and bedroom are quite noisy. The airconditioner in the lounge is mounted in a very unfortunate spot. In order to get the airflow going you have to shift the sofa away which will then block the door to the bedroom pretty much. The bed is comfortable. The biggest flaw, however, is the bathroom. It is a tiny frosted glass cubicle that stands right in the little lounge/kitchenette area and gives you no privacy. If you are travelling alone and have no visitors, then ok. The sink is tiny with no place to put things apart from opening the mirror cabinet. For anyone who has travelled to Japan: it is small even for japanese standards. This is the reason why we would not stay here again. Shame to the bad design.
reviews.title: New apartments in good location but beware of the bathroom!

reviews.text: Having stayed here on my global trek for a 3 nights I was looking for a quiet place to sleep. What I found at City Tempo was the worst accommodation I have stayed at in my entire global trip. I don't expect perfection by any means. In summary, the room was ok as long as you like large pillows which cause neck ache and a short bed. The neighbour played music all night, everynight. The room was very stuffy and is made worse by the fact the airconditioner was excessively noisy. Having stayed there in summer, it was essential to have the aircondiitoner on which basically meant you cannot sleep. To try and sleep I would turn it off and wake up a couple of hours parched and sweaty. The bathroom was clean but was uber tiny (estimated at 1.5m wide by 2.5 long which includes a shower, toilet and wash stand). The doorman was very lovely but the front of house staff had no hospitality training and came across rude, uncaring and unhelpful. After politely waiting during check in while the hotel front of house was on the phone, once she hung up, I was greeted with a 'Yep' in a abrupt manner. The hotel is only staffed until 10pm so if you have any problems you have to wait until the morning.
reviews.title: Do not stay here

reviews.text: The hotel is close to the Vic Market which only operates three days during the week and the weekends. There is a supermarket across the road but no restaurants close by that open at night other than some dodgy Irish pub and a very expensive Chinese. restaurant.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have consulted trip advisor continually for years for assistance when choosing a hotel. I should mention this is the first time I have ever felt like I need to put a review on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having spent the past month in different hotels around Melbourne I can say without a doubt, City Tempo is THE WORST one so far. For a start they advertize themselves as a non-smoking hotel. Page 12 in the information guide provided in all rooms clearly states; Please be advised that ALL of our apartments and all public areas are NON-SMOKING. My first day here I had to close my balcony door because the people next door were smoking. A little later they decided it was party time. The noise was so bad I finished up calling the concierge. The next morning I requested a change of room and after some deliberation I was moved to another floor. The second day here passed uneventfully. On my third night I am woken at 03:30 AM by noise coming from one of the balconys. I initially though it was above me. I put my earplugs in but lo and behold they decided it was time for the partry to really get going! So after listening to the thump, thump, thump penetrating the earplugs, and it is by this time 04:40 AM, I was forced tocall the concierge again. It did indeed come from next door. Finally back to sleep and now I am woken at 07:30 by these same people at it again!!!!
reviews.title: Free wake up call

reviews.text: This apartments hotel only opened 25th October 2010 and so when we stayed they were still finishing a few things off and ironing out some issues but I have to say considering this it was a great experience.
reviews.title: New apartment style accommodation close to Victoria Markets with good facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 days here and were delighted with our choice of apartment. Location was perfect, close to Queen Victoria Markets, half a block to the free city tram and a short walk to the rest of the city. Sure the room may have been a bit small, but there were only 2 of us, we were only there to sleep, shower and eat breakfast and it had absolutely everything we needed, including a full kitchen, dishwasher and washing machine. What more do you need for a holiday? For a major city the price was more than reasonable, everything was brand new and spotless. Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.text: met up with a friend for a weekend in Melbourne. we booked the studio and yes it was small, but all that was needed was available. all very clean and convenient and sooo beautifully new. staff was helpful and friendly at all time. it is just a short walk from Victoria market and CBD just around the corner and still room is quiet. when we will go with the family in the near future I will definitely book this place.
reviews.title: what a beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked into City Tempo because our preferred accommodation was booked up during the Australian Grand Prix period. We'd read good things about the place on City Tempo, and the rates were quite reasonable. We are pleased to say that City Tempo turned out to be a great choice.
reviews.title: Tempo - right on the beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. we got our room within an hour of checking in even though we were early.
reviews.title: Perfect

description: Our stylish Studio & One Bedroom Compact Apartments offer all the essentials for a comfortable and enjoyable stay in Melbourne's exciting CBD. Furnished with a compact kitchen, the latest audio/visual appliances and WiFi internet. On site is a well equipped gymnasium, sauna, business centre and conference rooms.Ideal for both leisure and corporate guests, enjoy easy access to cafes, convenience stores, Melbourne Central and only metres to Queen Victoria Market.
